div.class: vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1577937945171 vc_row-has-fill vc_row-o-equal-height vc_row-o-content-middle vc_row-flex

div.p: Bonneville Academy is a public charter school located in Stansbury Park, Utah, that educates up to 702 students from kindergarten to 8th grade. As a STEM school, Bonneville Academyâs curriculum focus on Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math, allowing students to not only learn about these areas of focus but also have real world experiences.

div.class: vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1566754842080 vc_row-o-equal-height vc_row-o-content-middle vc_row-flex

div.div: Bonneville Academy was named for the Lake Bonneville, which covered a majority of Utah 32,000 to 16,800 years ago and literally shaped the topography of western Utah.

div.p: Bonneville Academy was named for the Lake Bonneville, which covered a majority of Utah 32,000 to 16,800 years ago and literally shaped the topography of western Utah. This ancient freshwater sea left an unmistakable geological signature in Tooele County. The remnants of Lake Bonneville, including Great Salt Lake and the Bonneville Salt Flats, continue to contribute to STEM-related fields of study.

ul.li: Exploration and experimentation will teach students about the many facets of science and how it relates to the world we live in.
The global economy of tomorrow demands students who have a strong understanding of the engineering design process.
Students will learn how technology influences our everyday lives by creating and building devices and software.
Math is a universal language, a language that is essential to success in the modern, globalized workforce.

p.strong: The Bonneville Academy mascot is a Marinerâone who navigates these scientific treasure troves, preparing for the waves of tomorrow. Our logo is a compass with four directional points symbolizing the four STEM areas:

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_0 col-2 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_left
vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid vc_row-o-equal-height vc_row-flex

div.div: They will learn to use the scientific method and will be given opportunities to test their hypotheses. Science will become a fun and engaging subject for all students.
Our future leaders must be able to solve problems and work outside the box that tradition and society have set. Learning to build and design will inspire many to help improve our future.
Teachers and students will use current technology throughout the school day, and will explore the global environment through virtual field trips with people and professionals throughout the world.

A solid understanding and fluency in all aspects of mathematics will give students the skills they need to be successful in a wide variety of careers, including the science, technology, and engineering fields.

div.class: uvc-heading ult-adjust-bottom-margin ultimate-heading-53365ea599ddd9485 uvc-460 accent-subtitle-color uvc-heading-default-font-sizes

div.h3: ``Preparing students for the waves of tomorrow``

div.class: uvc-heading ult-adjust-bottom-margin ultimate-heading-22015ea599ddd9da8 uvc-8842 accent-border-color uvc-heading-default-font-sizes
vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1566757258790 vc_row-o-equal-height vc_row-o-content-middle vc_row-flex

div.div: Bonneville Academy will foster critical thinking and problem solving skills in a challenging, student centered environment; by encouraging exploration in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM). Preparing students for success in our ever changing, dynamic world.
Preparing students for the waves of tomorrow.
